abstract.text: Initializes a vImage buffer with the contents of a Core Graphics image.

inlineContent.text: The destination vImage buffer. On output, an initialized buffer with all fields populated.
A

structure. Pass an empty structure to specify that the function populates the format with the properties of the Core Graphics image. Pass a populated structure to specify that the function converts the Core Graphics image to the format.
If the source image contains alpha information and the format doesn’t contain alpha information, this function flattens the source image against this parameter.
The source Core Graphics image.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Pass image data between Core Graphics and vImage to create and manipulate images.

abstract.text: A flag that disables vImage internal tiling routines.
A flag that prevents vImage from allocating additional storage.
The vImage function completed without error.
A flag that sets the behavior to the default.
Improve your app’s performance by converting image buffer formats from interleaved to planar.
Initializes a vImage buffer with the contents of a Core Graphics image.
An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, and row stride.
The description of a Core Graphics image.
Look up type aliases, data types, and constants the vImage library uses.
A bitmap image or image mask.
A bitmap image or image mask.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
